subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Henry VIII and the Church of England
description: A micro-lesson that makes Henry VIII and the Church of England usable.

hook.text: He wanted a divorce. The Pope said no. So he made his own church. England's Reformation was personal, not theological.

buildup.text: Henry VIII needed a male heir. His wife Catherine couldn't provide one. He asked the Pope to annul the marriage.

discovery.text: When Rome refused, Henry declared himself head of the Church of England in 1534. Religion bent to royal will.

twist.text: Henry stayed theologically Catholic. He just replaced the Pope with himself. The real changes came after his death.

climax.text: England's break with Rome was about power, not faith. But it permanently changed English-speaking Christianity.

punchline.text: Henry wanted a divorce, not a reformation. He got both anyway.

quiz.question: Why did Henry VIII break with the Catholic Church?
options: The Pope refused to annul his marriage
